byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Cedartown, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Police officers across South and Midwest defend affixing of decals bearing motto 'In God We Trust' on patrol cars; assert trend reflects patriotism and solidarity with colleagues; critics, who argue motto's display crosses constitutional line separating state and religion, appear to be fueling its use.
lead_paragraph: Many Southern and Midwestern law enforcement agencies have added the axiom to squad cars, angering often-distant critics who say the moves violate the separation of church and state.

headline.main: Police Agencies Defy Critics and Show ‘In God We Trust’
